message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>:
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;

public class Outputs{
    //INSTANCE FIELDS
    private Solution cwsSolution;
    private Solution bestSol;

    // CLASS CONSTRUCTOR
    Outputs()
    {
        cwsSolution = null;
        bestSol = null;
    }

    // SET METHODS
    public void setCWSSol(Solution cwsSol)
    {
        cwsSolution = cwsSol;
    }

    public void setOBSol(Solution obSol)
    {
        bestSol = obSol;
    }

    // GET METHODS
    public Solution getCWSSol()
    {
        return cwsSolution;
    }

    public Solution getOBSol()
    {
        return bestSol;
    }

    //PUBLIC METHOD printOutputFile()
    public void sendToFile(String outFile)
    {
        try
        {
            PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(outFile);
            out.write("***************************************************\n");
            out.write("*                      OUTPUTS                    *\n");
            out.write("***************************************************\n");
            out.write("\n");
            out.write("--------------------------------------------\n");
            out.write("Clarke & Wright Solution (parallel version)\n");
            out.write("--------------------------------------------\n");
            out.write(cwsSolution.toString() + "\n");
            out.write("--------------------------------------------\n");
            out.write("\n OUR BEST SOLUTION:\n");
            out.write("--------------------------------------------\n");
            out.write(bestSol.toString() + "\n");
            out.close();
        } catch (IOException exception)
        {
            System.out.println("Error processing output file: " + exception);
        }
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, the PrintWriter class is used to write data to a file. To print the result in the output file as .txt, you can use the write() method of PrintWriter. In the sendToFile() method, replace the out.println() statements with out.write() statements to write the data to the file. Make sure to include the necessary newline characters ("\n") to format the output properly.
